description:
So good! I loved it. The food was fresh. I had fish and chips. Can you really go wrong with this in San Francisco? Idk. But this was delicious. 

The service was fast and we found seats right away. The only thing that was like omg were all the birds lol. Almost got attacked on my way out but all in all I loved it. I'd definitely be back!
author: Michelle F.

description:
This restaurant was amazing! The clams were superb! We absolutely loved the use of the paper straws, especially since the restaurant was located so close to the water. It was a great way to experience authentic California culture. 

One improvement that could be made is air conditioning. Oh man, it was warm in there. Likewise, the menu choices were limited, but being that it was a specific type of restaurant, that made since! 

Again, it was an overall pleasant experience!
author: Ava K.

description: We enjoyed our food here. We were looking for something a little less busy then the other chowder places and this place definitely did the job! They have a little indoor seating and outdoor seating area. Just beware of how packed the tables will be! The food is great and prices are average! For 2 adults and 3 kids our meal was about 50-60 bucks.
author: Jade D.

description:
This is just shy of average. I had clam chowder in a bread bowl. It's mostly read. Nothing special. 
Would look elsewhere next time as many options exist. And too many pidgins inside. Yes. Inside.
author: Her And I.

description: I have the crab and shrimp chowder. It was good I didn't need to add salt but I like the taste. I'm not a big chowder person so I can't say oh this was awful our oldest was great but I will say I ate all the bread was soft and stopped up the juice perfectly. I'm not mad at it. But since I am not a chowder eater, I will probably not eat this again. It didn't do anything to win me over it was just good one what it was.
author: Celeste G.

description:
Don't get "Hooked".

Extremely lame and disappointing. Unless you like a veneer of substandard seafood over a pile of fries. 

There are plenty of better choices on the pier. Avoid this place.
author: Secret S.

description:
Super let down. 
The clam chowder tasted like the kind from the cans. Flavorless and bland. Definitely, not worth the money.
author: Alexander M.

description: Second time here, like better than boudins. Good hot freshly made food . Every place down here is a good choice. This is one of my favorites
author: Jason A.

description: Nice spot on the pier here in San Francisco.  I got the clam chowder and a fish wrap.  Great seating with some amazing views.  Quick and easy to be helped.  Fair prices.
author: Corey M.

description:
Worst service and food I ever ate.. they cheat customer credit card and wants cash only and refuse to change an order that is not even made yet. Not only I got a refusal for something I just order I was asked to get to the end Of the line if I want to talk about it.   

Besides the bad customer service, the food was horrible.. worst fish and chip I ever tried.. very very greasy .. look like oil hasn't been changed in years
author: John C.

description: Okay place to eat while in the area. Burger was good but hot dog was only so-so. For the hot dog I feel that the hot dog stand I got one from yesterday was so much better then the one this restaurant had to offer. I did go eat in the middle of the day so it was decently busy and ended up having to wait a little while for food. Location on this place is great though! Down by the pier, so a perfect easy spot to walk while walking down there. Overall, if your in the area not a bad stop.
author: Dakota S.

description: The crab and shrimp chowder was super delicious, but when in the bread bowl there wasn't as much as I would have liked. But I really enjoyed resting my feet in one of the quieter restaurants at the pier.
author: Rachelle L.

description: The portions are small and the food is lukewarm, not hot. Service is awful and run by young kids with no personality. Did I mention the food is not hot? Probably made a lot at first and left it to the heat lamps to keep lukewarm? Ordered fish and chips and as we all know it's not really good unless it's hot, fries still had brown peels on them, think it's laziness rather than style as they were also less than hot. $12 plus a $3 soda, worse I ever spent. McDonald's would've been better. 2 stars was so it didn't get pushed to the back unseen. I'd give it zero stars if possible. The adjoining Trish Mini Donuts with the same staff seems to be better, I mean how can one f...k up fried donuts and coffee? Lattes seem okay, haven't tried house coffee yet.
author: Ken K.

description:
Just walking by and peeked in, unfortunately looked with hungry eyes... the shrimp and crab chowder looked so tempting that I forewent my usual Chowder House experience next door.   Learned my lesson.... the line wasn't even long but it took FOREVER to get through it.  Seems like the girl up front was getting orders together along with taking the orders which made for a very long wait.  I was glad they jut had to pour my chowder in a bowl before I got too hangry  bad time management. 
I will never forsake my Chowder place again..... the chowder I had was dissapointing.  Pretty bland and my beer was $5!  Learned my lesson, when someone suggests a new chowder place... dont "clam" up.  Stick with what you know
author: Riley O.

description:
Yikes. This food is not good. The fries just taste stale, and the fried food is mushy. I had the seafood combo and all of the food tastes like it was frozen and deep fried... insides are just mushy. No flavor.

The service was good. The food, not so much.

This was my first time eating here, and I will not return. I was pretty disappointed.
author: Mel L.

description: Seafood tasted frozen. Too much cabbage on wraps used as a filler. Lunch for 4, including 2 beers, was over $100.  I'd venture down to the grotto and eat at one of the take out stands instead.
author: Dana B.

description: Loved their fried shrimp, it was encrusted in very crispy shell. We ordered the seafood sampler and that was really good too.
author: Varuni S.

description:
Tasteless and oily !

I went at night, so I did not see any birds inside as the other yelpers have reported.

I got the crab cake sandwich, fish wrap and sea food combo. The seafood is too oily and tasteless. It comes with fries and also a bland cabbage salad which is also used in the wraps and sandwiches. The sauce in the sandwiches and wraps is bland and creamy. No flavor at all. The same oily fried fish from the seafood combo goes into the wrap. Its not worth the price.

One of the workers compressed the garbage in the bin near the entrance with bare hands and then handed food to people without washing hands.

Good if you just want a (relatively) cheap bite and dont care how your food tastes. Even the McDonalds nearby is better than this.
author: Raghu B.

description: You'd think they'd be nicer to people that work in the area since we're easy repeat customers but no. They don't allow any custom orders, I wanted to add cheese, and said I'd pay extra, to the fish sliders since a dry chunk of fish on  dry chunk of bread doesn't sound like the most appetizing thing and the friendly cashier was like yeah probably but she then turned to ask a man who was just standing around doing nothing if she could charge me for some cheese and he looked up and just said no and shook his head. No explanation no apology no offer of an alternative. Honest I've been here before and they're expensive and not worth it. Try Wipeout at least they're friendly and accommodating.
author: Cristina H.

description: I ordered the shrimp and crab chowder and my son ordered the clam chowder so we shared and it was amazing. I recommend both.
author: Alma M.

description: Actually watched a cook crack open a box of frozen prebattered fish.  The coleslaw was absolutely disgusting and inedible.  I should have know by the price since a meal is only $12
author: Thomas M.

description:
Considering this place is on the pier, I'm very disappointed in the quality of fish & chips.

They give you the tiniest little paper basket to hold your fish & chips and it is the smallest portion for the amount you pay! I ordered a clam chowder in a sour dough bowl (came out to be around $10 for the clam chowder) and it was alright. The only reason why I settled for a clam chowder bowl here is because the line at Boudin was incredibly long.

The girl at the register was not having it. There were maybe 10 people standing around the register waiting for their orders (and I can understand because there is absolutely no place to stand considering the place is so small). The girl at the register would constantly shout "I CAN HELP THE NEXT PERSON IN LINE" with the most aggravated face. I was stuck behind all the people waiting for the orders when I was trying to get my order in. I was completely polite to the cashier and she was still stuck with an irritated face and gave me so much attitude. (I feel you girl, I have RBF too, but that's no way to treat a customer, ever).

Needless to say I will not be returning.
author: Linda C.

description: Awful! Just awful seafood.  I know for sure everything is frozen. Ordered chowder bread bowls and cashier handled the bread himself without gloves on after handling cash.  No one was wearing gloves, even the cook! I'm giving one star because I couldn't give a zero plus their clam chowder was okay, but not great.
author: Evelyn L.

description: Food was average at best but pretty sure I paid a king's ransom for it. Could have been ok if there weren't birds and bird shit everywhere (including serving areas). Move on to the next tourist trap.
author: Edwin R.

description: Grosss . Very over priced. Food is gross. The crab cakes were .... I don't even know. They don't make their own tarter sauce. Only good thing I can say is there was malt vinegar available so I could drench my food and get a little down, otherwise I threw it away. For it being in the pier I hoped it would at least taste somewhat decent.
author: Nicole B.

description: Giving 1 Star for many reasons. The food is definitely over priced for the quality that they serve. 10.99 for fish and chips and they don't even make their own tartar sauce. They give you those sad Heinz packets. The fish was soggy and lacked crunch. The manager (didn't have a name tag but she had a mustache) was really rude when I asked for a to go bag to put my box in. She told me that it was 25 cents for a to go bag which okay, I get San Francisco laws. But then she had the nerve to tell me that EVERYONE knows it's the law. I then said "you mean to tell me that people from out of town and out of state know about this law before coming"? And she said "yeah". Girl, please. There's a way to tell your customers about the law without being a smug asshole about it. Would NEVER EVER come back to this place. Management sucks at customer service.
author: Suz M.

description: A typical pier eatery, very quick but crowded. The food was greasy but still yummy.
author: Dena N.

description: Terrible food and service. We had the fish and chips and they were warm and soaked in grease. The coleslaw was disgusting I wish I had taken a picture, but it's in the trash.
author: Lori E.

description: Such a disappointment. It's a restuarant on a pier and they're serving frozen food. Garlic fries? Disappointment. It came out cold and soggy like it's been sitting there for an hour. Calamari? Gross too. Batter was shameful and it was small. Not fresh. Fish? Looked at the sister eating it, and i didn't want to try it. She was just eating it to not waste her money. The only thing that was okay was the clam chowder. I didn't really care for Chowder (couple doors down), but it was soooo much better than this place. Go there instead!
author: Linda S.

description:
I'm warning you, you're not going to like it here.

Visiting family in the bay area and feeling somewhat touristy at the time, we decided to stroll on down to Pier 39 and grab some "fresh" clam chowder.  It was Christmas Day and packed, so instead of being more selective about where we chose chowder, we instead opted for a shorter wait time.  Hook & Cook, even though we waited 10 minutes or so in line before ordering, won (unfortunately for us.)

Look, I know you're hungry--you've had to fight traffic just getting down to the pier, and you've spent time searching for over-priced parking--and since you're already here, you're kind of at the mercy to whatever restaurants are made available.  And I also know that you're thinking "fresh" clam chowder would hit the spot about now.  But here at Hook & Cook, the clam chowder isn't fresh.  It's from a can.  And it's pricey, over $8.00 for what little you'll receive in that sourdough bowl you've been eyeing.  Maybe you should just move on.

How do I know it's not fresh?  Check out the potatoes: the uniformity, the perfect cubes.  It's processed, canned.  Hook & Cook certainly isn't promoting "fresh" clam chowder, and that's fine, but neither are they revealing the chowder's  true origins.  I'm not bashing Hook & Cook or anything; I'm just letting you know what you're getting, that's all.

Added, we also ordered fried calamari (see photo).  I'm not sure as to why our $9.25 order of previously frozen calamari was half-filled with french fries, but it was; however, given the chowder letdown, we didn't question.  Maybe you should.
author: Craig F.

description: Literally came in for beer and fries. Beer was outstanding, and very very very cold. Fries were average. They all taste the same with a ton of ketchup which is how my family chooses to eat them.
author: Eddie H.

description:
Although the food they had sitting out for show didn't look very appetizing, it was cold and late and they had indoor seating so we decided to give it a try. 

We got the fish wrap, shrimp and chips and two clam chowder bread bowls. Price came out to about $42 which wasn't bad for eating at the pier. 

The fried shrimp came in 6 pretty large pieces. Freshly fried, they were delicious! I actually wish we got more of them. The fries were good too.

The clam chowder bread bowls were creamy and tasty. They had bacon in it so that probably made it taste even better. Good amount of clams. I do wish they cleared out the bread bowls more so we could have had more chowder. 

The fish wrap was just ok to me. Not that much fish in it but a ton of lettuce, tomato and a bit too much sauce. If they put more fish in it, it would be pretty bomb. The fish that was in it though was nice and crunchy. 

Lots of indoor seating as well as outdoor. Staff was friendly. Food is made pretty quickly. I think most places have things that they make better and things they don't. With this place, I'd definitely just stick with their clam chowder and shrimp and chips.
author: Susan M.

description: The fish and chips consisted of fries and two small pieces of fish.  The fish was mainly batter and tasted like it had been under heat lamps.  Calamari was a few scraps of squid that covered fries to make it look larger than it was.  I guess the price is moderate compared to what else is on the pier.
author: Nathan O.

description: Have to give this 1 star for health code reasons. The place had pigeons in the restaurant eating food off of the tables. I'll try and add pics. The food is ok, but the tables and surfaces do not seem clean. The staff doesn't really care about the birds which is concerning :(
author: Mike C.

description:
Nothing special and I'm going to keep this very brief. Don't order the clam chowder bread bowl. But if your want to try the other stuff the go right on ahead nothing special it's all deep fried food..

I think we ordered the stuff here because we were so hungry from not eating anything yet and walking around so it was like I.don't care I'm just going to order food here because it was convenient.
author: Tommy D.

description: Excellent Seafood Platter...yummy calamari, fried shrimp, and fish pieces. The best, the Philly Cheesesteak! The meat was tender and reminded us of Philly. Garlic fries were a great addition. Mmmmm...
author: Alana M.

description: Don't be fooled by the long line. My husband waited in line for over 30 minutes only to receive WARM beers and COLD clam chowders.  Go some place else.
author: Prizilla C.

description:
Huge mistake, should of checked yelp 1st.

Mediocre food,  tourist trap prices and a buck fifty charge for a refill of your coke. 

2016 and they don't do free refills?  Whaaa?
author: Chris W.

description: I don't often look up places before I eat there but today I did.. Most of the reviews are bad but I decided to try hook & cook anyways because most people are complaining about the stupidest things. I ordered fried shrimp, garlic fries and a Heineken. The beer was a little on the flat side but the food was really good. The fried shrimp was perfect nice and crispy The garlic fries were good but I've had better. With that being said when I do return to the pier I would definitely eat here again.
author: N S.

description: Good enough.  Decently fast and food is ok.  Sandwhiches have a lot of bread and not much crab, etc... will pass on this place next time on pier 39
author: Alli W.

description:
The fish to chip ratio was a little low. Really good food, ate there with the family, but for the price, three pieces would have been better.

Garlic fries were also great!
author: Alex L.

description: This place sucks.  Fish is frozen.  Small portions.  Expensive for what you get.  Do yourself a favor and wait in line at one of the better restaurants.  You came all the way here after all.  Spend a little more to enjoy the experience.
author: Bart D.

description: My bf and I were being super touristy and thought that this place looked more "authentic" than wipeout. There were 4 groups  in front of us and the line moved quickly. We waited no more than 5 minutes for our food and it was good. We got the crab cake sandwich and the seafood combo.  The crab cake was good and was on a soft, light roll. I wouldn't recommend getting the seafood combo because everything was fried and slightly greasy... Doesn't sit too well if you eat the whole thing. I sampled the clam chowder as well. If you like bacon, you'll like the chowder here. You can really taste the bacon. The only downside is that we sat by the door and watched as pigeons (not sure how they got inside) almost decapitate guests... :(
author: Lily V.

description:
I went here once and got their clam chowder in a bread bowl and the clam chowder was delish! So much better than Boudin's. There were lots of clam, not so much potatoes (which I like), it's more flavorful than Boudin's in my opinion. The bread wasn't that good though. 

The next time I come back I will get the clam chowder in a cup.
author: Michelle T.

description: My wife and I went there yesterday and ordered the fish & chips. After one bite of the fish, I was done. On the way out, I took a close look at the area where the food was being prepared and noticed the cook grabbed a bag of frozen fish sticks and put them in the fryer...my mistake by not checking how food was being prepared. Don't make the same mistake.
author: Farshid K.

description:
Typical pier food. Overpriced/poor value. Quality is not so great. Don't expect fresh seafood just because they're located by the pier.

Fries sucked. Tasted like frozen fries from the supermarket.

Fried fish tasted like cheap frozen fish.

Clam chowder in sourdough bread: bread didn't seem fresh, and clam chowder was too thick and boring in flavor. I'd be happier spending $2 for canned clam chowder.

Tourist trap.
author: Vinh C.

description:
Slow service, employees are more concerned with answering the phone than serving customers.

Food is very expensive and nothing you could not get in a gas station.  You would have less stomach trouble eating some roadkill than after eating the food offered at this "restaurant."

This is the typical tourist trap, in general stay away from the pier

This place is not fast and they don't even offer edible food.  Get roadkill instead.
author: Q K.

description:
I'm not sure why reviews are so low here, this is a classic FastSeaFood joint. It looks like most people are expecting something magical while ordering deep fried comfort food. This is not a restaurant, but a quick bite place.

It looks like sometimes the team is running behind on orders during the rush hours, and the table area could have be kept in a cleaner state. On the positive side, plenty of sitting is available inside and outside, so feel free to enjoy your day by the ocean.

I had shrimp&crab chowder in a bread, and it was as good as it can get. The soup texture was great, the taste a little spicy. Overall my husband and I had a positive experience.
author: Julia G.

description:
Stopped here because I wanted seafood and there weren't many fast options for that on the pier.

I had the seafood platter which was just okay, nothing exceptional. Staff wasn't very friendly. Take a few steps over to Fisherman's Wharf to find something better.
author: Emily W.

description:
Standard touristy fare but priced low by Fisherman's Wharf standards. 

The crab chowder in a sourdough bun was surprisingly good, though I would have liked more chowder in it.

Meal for 2 -  $21 (excluding drinks)
author: Umesh T.

description:
More like a 3 minus....Food was decent ( I enjoyed my fish and chips, and the soup in bread bowl was great ), and my Goddaughter enjoyed her shrimp dish. 

However, my little sister's hot dog looked and tasted quite gross. Another con is her hot dog, soda, and fries were close to $13 by itself, and refills were extra.

The food was overall decent, but for the price I paid for food for me and two kids totaling $50+ seems ridiculous.....for that price, I would hope they would put more care in all of their food....not just their fish. 

If its on the menu, it should be given the same amount of care as your specialties.
author: Dan W.

description: This place sucks. And when I say "it sucks" I mean it really sucks! Food is awful. Would never eat here again.  It has really gone down hill since our last visit.
author: Laura s.

description:
Good food, good prices (especially compared to most other places on Pier 39). There were other people there, but no line for me. The seating was comfortable as well. It was a nice place to relax for a bit after spending a lot of time driving to SF & walking around.

I had a couple problems with this place, though. I felt like the staff there didn't have enough to do, although they probably should have been cleaning tables and floors. They all stood and stared at me while I tried to figure out was to order (there were three people behind the counter, none of which spoke to me at all before I approached to put in my order). Also, there were constantly birds walking and flying through. Seemed unsanitary. I witnessed one bird poop on the floor right next to my table, as well as an employee pass right by the mess, notice it enough to step around it, but did NOT clean it up.
author: Elaine V.

description: Great chicken wrap and nice atmosphere. Good views of the bay and great for people watching. Would definitely come back here again.
author: Amy T.

description:
After sitting at mangos for 40 minutes with no drinks or acknowledgement we came here. 
Pros:
1. Food came out within minutes. If you get the chowder bowls you get it when your paying, but if you get fish and chips or any of the made to order items you just wait with your ticket number.
2.Great menu

Cons.
1. Not very clean
2. Can be kind of crowded (but then its SF and the Wharf)


WHAT TO ORDER:
- I had the fish and chips which were mediocre. DONT ORDER
- My Husband had the shrimp and crab chowder- OMG SO DELICIOUS- it tasted like lobster bisque!! Creamy, buttery, loaded with crab and shrimp goodness!
- My sister in law had the clam chowder which was very good as well, It had a good amount of bacon, Bacon in anything is yummy!
author: Renu D.

description: Skimpy.... Terrible service you stand around while random employees look at you or scream orders from behind the counter. Finally someone will direct you to a cash register to order. Doesn't seem to be a ryme or reason to the "system". You then scramble for a filthy table or counter that doesn't appear to have been cleaned that day. I got a combo basket bland limp fries, 2 small deep fried fish filets, 2 deep fried shrimp and a tiny amount of  calamari. Everything was low end frozen stuff. I got my son a hot dog that took forever to finally be ready. It was a decent grilled dog on a huge non toasted or grilled soft french roll. Also there are pigeons flying around inside. Tourist trap definitely never repeat.
author: Aaron W.

description:
Not bad for a place on the pier. Get the seafood combo/platter and upgrade to garlic fries.  You have to pay extra for the garlic fries but they give you more than what comes in the combo.  You get a full order of garlic fries.  Which, by the way, were absolutely BOMB.  

Still a bit pricey for what you get, but I'd say this was the best value. 
I also tried the clam...and shrimp chowder, but I don't recommend this at all.  Very little seafood in it, and it tasted like straight up melted butter! :( Pricey for what you got too. 

One thing I didn't like about this was how long it took me to get my food.  People who ordered after me got their food before I did.
author: Kay A.

description:
I was hungry, and meandering around Pier 39 looking for something to eat. I figured I'd get something fishy. I was on the pier after all.  The sign for this place intrigued me. I know I'm not supposed to 'judge a book by it's cover' but this 'cover' was neat, and I went in to eat. The outside tables were full, and the inside tables were also full. It's a pretty crowded place! I guess they're doing well. 
     I walked over to the lengthy line, and stood for a moment, when a girl opened up another register and shouted 'I'll take whoever's next!" I looked, and the people in front of me appeared to be staying, so I switched lines to place my order. I looked up at the menu board, and decided upon Clam Chowder in a bread bowl, and an order of garlic fries. I went with the 'San Francisco' style as I'm from New England, and have experienced more than my fair share of 'New England' style clam chowder.  I paid, and before the transaction was done, a bowl of soup was placed in front of me. I picked it up, and found some counter space to sit at.
     Before too long my garlic fries were ready, and I went up to get them. I returned to my counter spot, and after the yelp photo, I began to eat. The chowder was an orange-ish shade, but it was still delicious.  Clams and shrimp were in this version of chowder. It was warm, and slowly seeping into the Sourdough bread bowl. After eating the soup, and bowl...I was actually quite full. But I did manage to stuff down about half the order of garlic fries. The garlic fries were just okay. The chowder was rightfully the main dish.

     I may or may not be back? There's alot of stuff on Pier 39 to see and eat at. This one was good, but lots of other places caught my eye (and stomach) to see next time.
author: Scott B.

description: Not bad, It was a tad crowded and the clam chowder breadbowl was very dry but the soup itself was good!. its nothing compared to boudins but my friend wanted to tried the chicken sandwich and he was prettty happy about that. I also got the garlic fries and that was yummy
author: Nancy W.

description: We stop here for their great clam chowder in a bread bowl. It has been one of the best clam chowder we have tried. I definitely recommend this place.
author: Mari M.

description: We ordered fish and chips, the fish was dripping with oil an the fries were dry and unpleasant. I wish he had gone somewhere else, this place made us ill.
author: Kassiah W.

description:
We ate here because we wanted something pretty quick and relatively inexpensive on Pier 39. Tall order in the middle of the summer and in San Francisco :-)

The service here was pretty quick which was a plus. The seating of course was sparse, but that is to be expected. The main reason they get stars taken off is because there was really very little that a vegetarian could eat. My daughter had to have french fries and mozzarella sticks. I eat fish, so of course that wasn't a problem :-) no, I don't have any suggestions on what they should serve for vegetarians. 

Fish and chips were pretty decent. The batter was light, and they were nice and hot, but the portion could've been a bit larger. One thing that gets five stars is the coleslaw. Usually coleslaw sauce is way too sweet and gooey. This was more like cabbage and cilantro tossed in a bit of vinegar, which was just delicious.

The napkins were pretty small and we needed to take a whole lot of them for our greasy fingers :-) 

They had samples of all of the food items out so that you could see them when you were ordering. That was convenient. Overall, not a bad place for the family for a quick fried fish treat.
author: Rene B.

description: I don't understand why the rating is so low, had a cup of crab soup and crab cake sandwich, soup was amazing! Definitely hit the spot on a chilly windy day
author: Cecilia L.

description: Delicious clam chowder and you can get a beer outside for just a couple bucks! The bread bowl fills you up but it is really good ha ha
author: Addison M.

description: Maybe it's because I've lost my interest in tourist traps like Pier 39, or because I'm tired, but I was not impressed with this place. I got the seafood combo which was shrimp (2), fish (2 medium size) and calamari (maybe 5 or 6 pieces). No cocktail sauce in this entire place, or at least I couldn't find it. Staff seemed disinterested in everything. Had to ask for my drink because they weren't going to give it to me --and apparently they were supposed to give it after I paid for my order while waiting for my food. It wasn't busy but it was a longer wait than what it should have been. Several others got their order before me and they had been behind me in line. Birds were in the restaurant and they unsuccessfully tried to shoo them out. I think everything I got was frozen and they just dumped it into the fryer. Needless to say, if I ever come back to Pier 39, I won't be stopping here.
author: Amy D.

description:
Everytime I am forced to go to Pier 39, I always come here and eat the deep fried clams. 

This place is extremely busy at times (service can lag).
Seagulls are always around along with their poop.
Not only that, seating can be limited due to how busy it is.

But I will say this. I love deep fried clams and the clam chowder.
author: Roger A.

description:
Hook & cook could serve better food. 
The people behind the counter are nice, they acknowledge you're present which I thought it was nice. We order the bread bowl with clam chowder and I have to say it was ok but I've had way better and cheaper before. The bread was super cold and chowder salty and watery. I think they should rosy the bread and make the chowder a bit richer, that would make them better then the rest of their competition.
author: Tarcisio G.

description:
Came here for lunch.
I ordered the grilled salmon hot sandwich, and a side of peppers and onions.
Quantity was good, taste was very good, I really liked the dressing/sauce they put on the ciabatta roll. 

The peppers and onions had only had like two pieces of pepper and rest was onions, but it tasted good.

I would come back to try more here.
author: Parminder Nayyar C.

description:
Hellllll nope.

We came here a few weeks ago because I thought it looked cool and there were a lot of customers inside. I guess we came at the wrong time because the employees looked done for the day.

The lady who took our order was a bit rude. We've never been here before, so I'm sorry that we were a bit confused. Basically, you tell someone what you want and they send/tell the person at the register what it is. We ordered clam chowder in a bread bowl and fish and chips. Instead of regular fries with the fish, we wanted to upgrade it to garlic fries. This seemed to piss the lady off and I could tell she was trying to shove us towards the register as fast as she could.

At the register, however, a different lady was nice. The only part that wasn't so nice was the price. From what I can remember, everything was close to $30, but that's Pier 39 for ya. Even still - that's way too high. 

Finding a place to sit was interesting. Most of the front dining area was taken but they have a small hall of picnic tables. As I was walking over to that section, one of the male employees pulled out one of the benches to block the walkway. I looked at him confused and he just kinda looked at me like nothing was wrong. Yo, I had my hands full and I wanted to sit. He told me that we couldn't sit over in that area but there was a large family at the very end of the hall. They were loud and drunk, it seemed like. I told him I wanted to and he finally moved the bench. Okay, I understand that we were there 15 minutes before you guys closed, and I honestly hate being "that person," but we didn't know about your hours. What he did was absolutely rude, in my opinion. There was a time where he was refilling the condiments on the table and he just grabbed the ketchup bottle or whatever from our table without saying excuse me. Aight. He also stood around our table for a while just checking himself out in the mirror... It was kinda creepy. 

Anyway, the food. I thought the clam chowder was okay. It had a smoky flavor to it, which I'm not a fan of. It did taste like it came straight out of a can and the consistency matched canned clam chowder (overly thick). The bread bowl was stale and rough. If the clam chowder doesn't soften the bread bowl enough to where you can easily rip the bread apart, then it's all wrong. I was seriously putting a lot of effort in tearing up that bowl. As for the fish, it was waaaaayyy too greasy. The funny thing was that there was more breading than the actual fish. Finally, the garlic fries were not okay. I honestly do not like garlic fries but I've had better. They put a lot of garlic but it was just a pile that fell right off of the fries when you picked them up. Because of that, the fries barely had the flavor. 

I guess this place is worth a shot, but there are better places with similar food choices. For me, I don't think I will return. The service turned me off and the food was definitely not worth the price. 

Hell nope.
author: D C.

description: Absolutely the worst service I have ever experienced.  Stood in line to order for WAY TOO LONG and found out that we were in the wrong line, NO SIGNAGE AND NO HELP FROM ANYONE BEHIND THE COUNTER though so many workers kept walking up to us.  When asked if we were in the correct line, crappy response from the folks behind the counter.  Crappy crappy crappy!  Bad service!
author: Beth N.

description: Crab and Shrimp Chowder Bowl was wonderful. Fresh Garlic Fries...amazing. Staff was nice enough. Fast service.
author: Heidi L.

description: Nope! Don't waste your money here... Had many clam chowders before, so we came to San Francisco and of course you must have clam chowder at the pier! Well this was the worst clam chowder yet. Definitely thumbs down.
author: Luisa P.

description: Don't fall for this tourist trap.  I made the mistake of not checking yelp before coming here :( fish & chips for $10 was so small,  2 small pieces of fish& stingy chips :( soup bowl was stale bread & cold soup
author: Jessica M.

description: My shrimp & crab chowder was missing something. But my seafood combo was GOOD.  The octopus was crispy and light fish perfectly cooked with yummy shrimp. Note if you order a pitcher of beer the is a $3 deposit.
author: Tova V.

description: All I can say is they serve frozen , poor quality and pricey food and not very friendly staff - avoid if possible.
author: Jitendra S.

description:
Wanted to try a new fish and chips place besides the place I usually go to (Pier Market Seafood).  

Got the seafood combination, the food was average, not very good actually compared to other fish and chip places.  When I took the first bite of fish.. I was a litle surprised at how fishy it tasted, I asked the waitress if they used catfish and she hesitantly insisted it was a "type" of Cod.. fishy fishy..

Outside tables were relatively clean, birds freaking EVERYWHERE.. which the staff is so used to they carry around spray bottles to hose them down, even INSIDE the restaurant.. shooting whatever is in their bottles all over the counters and eating surfaces.. gross

There was a group of 4 japanese girls trying to eat INSIDE, but were being terrorized by a flock of 15 pigeons literally tearing apart food left by a guest who didn't throw their stuff away..

TLDR, meh fish and chips, crazy birds, touristy.. will default back to Pier Market  just a couple doors down next time I'm in town..
author: Joseph L.

description: Three of us are here after hanging out with the seals at Pier 39. The total bill was $46! Two of us had crab cake sandwiches, split a sourdough bread bowl with crab and shrimp and the little guy had a kids corn dog meal, plus 3 large drinks. The price is unbeatable at the pier. The food was good.
author: Lola M.

description:
Very disappointing. If I weren't so hungry and rushed to dig in, I would have remembered to take a picture of the sad excuse for my order. I ordered the fried calamari and the garlic fries.  I wouldn't be so critical if it weren't for the fact that I settled on this establishment when there are so many others I should have looked at. I paid near $10 for a small serving of 7 pieces of what they must have considered to be calamari.  The fries made the small pieces look ridiculous.  Also their "slaw"...it was like the portion you would get in a ketchup cup.  Those small paper ones.  I didn't even touch it. It was such a disappointment.  The only thing that kept my mind off of it was the cold beer they had on tap.  $16 for a pitcher of Dos Equis amber. By the way, they do take a $3 deposit for the pitcher so you're obliged to return it at the register for that money back.

Will not be back here for food. Maybe the drinks.
author: Yen T.

description: Not the best representation SF has to offer. Chowder - don't even bother. So basic. You may as well buy canned soup. This had no taste and the bread tasted gross. Dodge.
author: Roxy A.

description:
OK food at a "tourist trap" place, for reasonable price. Pigeons in the restaurant, CA Health department - Hello! There was a little boy who was molested by an overly aggressive pigeon and left his food there. They take my order and read it back. I of course do not listen. I am from the old country. They manage to get it wrong and they blame me!
OK, I was not insulted.  Over all not terrible but almost comical place. Fast service and they gave us a $1 diff when exchange the order.  They do not validate garage parking tickets. Oh well....
author: Andras N.

description: Food was ok and not over priced for being in a touristy area. I give it 3 stars because there were pigeons coming in to the restaurant and landing on table tops etc and they didn't wipe down after which was gross. My little sister had a corn dog and said it was good. I had a hot link and it was pretty good. I would come back here with a child but not with my friends. They had a grilled chicken sandwich that looked pretty tasty but I didn't get it bc my sister wanted us to each get hot dogs :/
author: Taylor P.

description: Great food, finally a place in SF with beer batter fish and chips(and malt vinegar). Loved the food, the only problem about it is the pigeons flying by all the time but apart from that they serve really good food.
author: Morgan D.

description: I tried their chili bread bowl this past weekend and it was really really bad! I was sick to my stomach and still can't get the horrible taste of the soup out of my mouth. I don't recommend eating that at all!! Complete waste of my money. I'm pretty damn sure that meat in the chili wasn't cooked throughly smh
author: Deliah A.

description:
Got fish & chips, the batter was a bit hard and the portion was quite small, mostly made up by the chips. The chips themselves were simply not up to par - frozen, dry, and served lukewarm. Quite expensive for the quality. 

No wonder it was the only store on the pier without a line
author: Sara L.

description: Okay so we are at pier 39 and wanted fish and chips. My phone was close to dying so I didn't bother yelping this place first, BIG mistake! After ordering and paying I saw them pull out the frozen fish from a bag!  The staff was rude and was yelling out all the orders.  The food was terrible! It was the worst meal I had throughout my vacation!  Do yourself a favor do not eat here.  I can't tell you how bad this place is, we didn't finish our meal.  Yes it was that bad, Yuk!!!! Do not waste your time or money on this place!
author: Peter C.

description:
When I came here last time, I had a sudden urge to grab fish and chips. 

Even though there were plenty of places to eat on Fisherman's Wharf, we decided to stay at the front of the pier and grabbed something quick to eat.

Fish and Chips are weird for me because for the life of me, I'm assuming it's literally a fry fish and potato chips. It's not until my later years I would discovered it's only a quick deep fried battered fish and fries.

I think the place was picked was because of its colorful exterior with some outdoor benches in front of the place. Not recommended to sit out there and eat because the wind kept blowing our napkins and food off the table. The food itself was not that remarkable and was charged to a premium touristy price.

it was only worth because we were starving, otherwise the fries were stale and the fish tasted like chicken strip. Very ho-hum.

If I can take a fried fish and chips, that would have been awesome because for the rest of my trip, I wound up going to three more fish & chips place.

They were all marginally better than this shack. Aye Caramba!
author: Mike L.

description: We tried the crab cake and the chowder. Both was pretty good. Easy and quick eat at the pier.
author: Barbi S.

description: Ordered clam chowder and corndog with fries for my son. Asked for no salt on the fries and the cashier told me the fries already had salt on them. You can't tell your cook to make a small batch without salt? Im pretty sure your fries don't already have salt while theyre in the fryer. That wouldnt make any sense. I worked fast food and know exactly how that works. The clam chowder was pretty good, they just need to add more clam chowder than bread though. Their prices are a bit too much but what would you expect from a tourist trap? Oh, and no free fountain drink refills unless you spill the whole thing on the floor.
author: Rosan C.

description: This place was just average for me. They don't give you very many shrimp for the price you pay. But the shrimp was very tasty and good so I rate them 3 stars. They need to be more clean tho. The tables were dirty and I had to clean mine myself
author: Annette R.

description: Food is great. We got the Fish Wraps which were amazing. Also, Mozzarella Sticks were good. Pigeons were inside and flying around which was the only drawback. But other then that, good place.
author: Miguel R.

description:
My co-worker and I had gone for a walk down the Embarcadero - it was a beautiful day out, sunny and warm by San Francisco standards. We ended up at Pier 39 and found ourselves in want of some food.

In true form to its touristy locale, the food is lackluster and the prices a bit high. For $10, I came back with a paltry two pieces of fish, breaded too heavily and cooked too long. The fries didn't fare much better, and the tarter sauce tasted jarred.

Do yourself a favor - walk down to the Ferry building and spend the $10 on better quality food.
author: Robert H.

description:
Walkin around the wharf one day and we got a bit hungry. Since we've never tried this joint we decided to give it a go.

This place looks like its being run by students but not in a bad way. They move fast and know their orders. Its amazing actually.

Food wise, well its average. This is what we had...

- Clam Chowder bowl
- Garlic Fries
- Fish and chips

The chowder bowl was nice and hearty, its nice for the cold wind at the pier. The Garlic fries were EH, loads of garlic but got soggy pretty fast. Thats too bad. Fish and chips, they were good. I enjoyed it. Nothing special, it just looks and tastes like fried white fish.

Overall its a decent place to drop by for a quick meal, and after you are done you can go some Mini Donuts. Its right outside of this place.
author: phillip w.

description:
Ordered clam chowder on a sourdough bread. 

Meh.. Not so good or tasty clam chowder. For $8, i will say it's good if you don't have any other option but here. 

I think because lots of tourists, their service is really bad.
author: Aril A.

description: this place has a really good food but the customer service was terrible . the cashier i will say a philipino lady so rude and a really  big attitude it was so disappointed the way my friend and I were treated she didn't knowledge in other words she ignore us pretend she didnt understand what I ordered i only asked if the served moscato a wine.. and she was rude saying "what is that" i dont know anything" anyways we talked with the manager explained him what happened about her and her big ego attitude and the way she was telling her co workers that what was wrong with this "ladies"the manager apologize to us brought us some dessert but still they should improve they customer service specially in this tourist area.
author: Gianina V.

description: Wow, why did I eat here? Mostly, why did I bring my kids to eat this crap? It looked like the food would be ok walking up but as soon as I got to the counter I wanted to walk out but my husband didn't want to because he was being hungry and impatient ( yes, he's like having a 3rd child at times ). But that impatience got us stuck with a horrible meal at extremely unclean tables. The food was super greasy yet flavorless. They're were pigeons pooping all over and begging. Just nasty. Never again.
author: Roo P.

description:
Don't go, stay out! 
Calm chowder has no flavor, hot dog taste like a peace of plastic. Customer service is extremely slow. Workers walk around like zombies. Place was empty when we walked in, I had to go up to the counter and remind them about my order but they where to busy texting.
This is the kind of place that gives food on wharf a bad rep.
author: Raw W.

description: Poor service. Paid $10 for a plate of shrimp that included 4 shrimp and a bunch of soggy fries. Avoid this restaurant!!!
author: Doug S.

description: Grabbed lunch here before catching the boat to Alcatraz.  The food came out quick and it was good.  The kids meal was big.  I had the fried shrimp it was great!  Their slaw was good.  For a quick meal I thought it was great and there was plenty of seating inside and out.  This is a fast food type place and it is in a pricey tourist location.
author: Molly G.

description: I'm wavering between a 3 and a 4, but the 4 it will be.  Mostly because the customer service was really nice -- and it is surprisingly a bit difficult to find a clam strips dinner in the SF area.  It was gourmet, but hit the spot, and the fries were really good too.  Wish they had slightly more comfortable tables to sit on, but all in all -- a good spot.
author: Mel G.

description:
Service was awful!!! These Asians were rude!!! But on the bright side the fish tacos were yummy!!!! 

Evil Asians great fish tacos.
author: Carle S.

description:
This place is slow and inconsistent.  The chicken fingers basket is way too expensive ($8 for two pieces and a small amount of soggy fries).  Fish & chips has equally soggy fries and okay tasting fish.  It's a better value with three pieces for $8 but I can get better tasting fish and more fries from Carl's Jr. for three dollars less.

I'm not coming back.
author: Barry W.

description:
Food: Chowder was really good. Creamy, chunky, and tasty.
Fish & Chips are way overpriced for the two measly sized fish they give you. However the fish was crispy and still tender on the inside.

Cleanness: Pretty nasty! There are so many pigeons that fly in and out of this place. They are pretty bold and tend to fly onto the tabletops. As they were flying out the place, they almost grazed the heads of the tourists!

Price: About $20 for those two measly things. But it's pier 39, what do you expect? Taking that into consideration there are plenty of better places around the wharf!
author: Karen L.

description: Awesome food! Great selection of seafood, yummy blend of flavors, and fun atmosphere.  Highly recommended this place if you're looking for a little bit of everything Pier 39 has to offer!
author: Eddie A.

description:
As I enter the establishment first thing that pops out is their Crab Chowder. Instantly of course, I HAD to order this.  There was also clam chowder which was tempting but I was set on the Crab Chowder.  My mouth was watering, the anticipation of that first taste was killing me. I continuously blow on the chowder on my spoon, making sure I don't burn my tongue & ruin the experience.  Finally, I taste it & it was... dull.  Grabbed the pepper, surely the pepper will make a difference... Nothing.  *Sigh. This sucks.  I should've checked yelp first.  One of the very few times, I don't check reviews on yelp & I was very disappointed!!  Normally, it's whatev, right?! But it cost an arm & leg that I was sure I was going to enjoy it.  

Oh well... I learned the hard way...
author: Paige J.

description:
Regrets, regrets. I am ashamed of myself for living in SF and going here. It made me seem like I am a tourist in my own city!

Why, oh why didn't I bust out my $70 a month smartphone and YELP it before I head into this place?!

And once I got in I should have went straight out. The two reasons are: #1.) Pigeons were EVERYWHERE! ON TOP OF THE TABLE AND under your feet!!! Jeesus!
and #2.) It's a fish and chip/clam chowder joint owned and operated by Asians!

It's like going to a PHO place operated by African Americans and Sushi place operated by White. In general, that's not a good sign. In general, but not in 100% of the cases.


$17 for a very small portion of fish and chip and one clam chowder bread bowl. The lady that made my bread bowl had no gloves on and handled the bread after operating the cash register. The fish and chip only came with 3 small pieces of friend fish fillet and a small order of fries that were soggy.

And get this; it took them 15 mins to get a premade meal out. All they had to do is put it in their 1000 degree fryer and pour the premade PROGRESSO clam chowder in the breadbowl! There was only 2 orders in front of us.

Dam I regret coming here. I have no one to blame but myself. Why did I not go to the other 99 GREAT seafood restaurant at the PIER!!!!????

Stay away. Don't be tricked in here because alot of clueless tourist is sitting outside and it make this place seem decent. It's not!

Don't be hook into this place, not even considered a restaurant, I will call it a place. Because once you are hooked, you are cooked!!!!

So unless you want you want to dine with pigeons and eat premade fake clam chowder at a fake seafood restaurant, be my guest. Don't say YELP didnt tell you.
author: U L.

description:
This was one of the one places my friends and I saw that served both a crab chowder and clam chowder. It took us a while. The crab chowder was a crab and shrimp chowder that was tomato-based, and it was really good. I still liked the original clam chowder, but it was definitely worth a try. I thought it was a little cheaper than some of the other places on the pier.

Bottomline: Good stuff! My other friends ordered a salmon ciabatta (which was delightful) and a chicken ciabatta. They came with this house sauce, and that made the sandwich.
author: Jeremy T.

description: I was craving chowder so I grabbed a cup of shrimp and crab chowder ($6.45) and a side of slaw ($2.50) to go and went in my merry way. I was content at the fair pricing in an expensive city (and an expensive part of an expensive city). When I arrived home I unpacked my light dinner. My first impression was that both items were surprisingly greasy looking. The chowder had a "slick" of oil on it. Although the soup was salted and seasoned to perfection, I was not pleased with the oily texture and total lack of crab and shrimp :( The slaw was un impressive as well. It was pretty oily and not very crispy due to not being chilled (like on ice or kept in a fridge). In the restaurant's defense, I will add that the slaw is typically an add-on to sandwiches and wraps as a condiment or a garnish for dinner plates. I will try another seafood stand next time-- I know there's some badass chowder in this town!
author: Andrea H.

description: We have been here twice and have always liked the creamy clamp chowder in bread bowl. The fried prawns and fish and calamari were not that impressive. Best to stay away from fried stuff. Service has been quick. It is always crowded and we have been lucky to find a seat/high stool inside...sharing a table with others. This place is a good option when you are in a rush and don't want to spend a lot. However, it can be messy and unclean.
author: Dipika B.

description:
Very pricey for fish and chips. The fish smelled and tasted super fishy. It made the food inedible because I feared I would get food poisoning. My friend and I did not want to deal with a sit down dinner with wait staff and the whole ordeal, so we opted for Hook and Cook. We were better off going somewhere else. I wish I would have checked the reviews first. Not only was the fish bad, they give the gross tartar sauce packets, the place is filthy, and an employee took all the condiment towers from the tables, including ours. He actually asked me to give him the ketchup and Tabasco while we were still eating our fries. 

Bad service, bad quality, dirty location, and overpriced. Stay away from Hook and Cook!
author: Kat M.

description:
if i could give it negative stars or 0 stars i would. We get there its super crowded so we assume that its popular and good. No just popular and im assuming its only because of the attraction of feeding nasty diseased pigeons that swamp at you for your food because the food couldnt have been the reason so many people were there. The price couldnt have been the reason so many people were there because you pay and arm and a leg for fish and chips alone. The customer service couldn't have been the reason because they were either busy rolling their eyes at you for a simple request of "please clean the bird crap off the table so we can sit" or they were too busy texting. Super rude!! 

So we were there 7/14 and we sit down on a filthy table. The birds are everywhere and there is literally no control or anything they do to try to detour this. These birds are clearly diseased as we saw one missing toes from the mites!! OMG! We FINALLY get our order which took forever btw, and it was so greasy you have to pile vinegar on your fish and chips just to eat it. It was tasteless and greasy!! The food was AWEFUL!!! I couldnt finish my food at all because i simply couldnt stomach it. I left feeling like i ate a brick. I didnt feel good at all. Seriously if you need an excuse to get out of going somewhere go here and eat because you WILL  get food poisening. I witnessed a guy behind the counter touch his face then touch someones food!!! SHOULDNT HE WEAR GLOVES?! and not touch your face!!!
author: Ellen S.

description:
Compared to other places on the pier, this place is very cheap and its a good place if you want something quick and filling to hold you off until dinner time.

The workers are consistent and very hospitable; it's understandable to be a little over the edge since it gets pretty busy and customers tend to act rude when their hungry. But other than that, the food (grilled chicken burger& hot link sausage) was really good! The coleslaw that is put inside the burger makes it really tastey and unique compared to other burgers. ITS A MUST TRY!
author: Kate P.

description:
3.35
They let my dog inside or pretended they didn't see her. 
They had really good red chowder soup in a bread bowl and they were open earlier than any of the other touristy spots on the pier. 
Yay for Hook & Cook!
author: Barbara D.

description: Crab & seafood chowder, clam chowder was good, not great. Bread bowl was bad, very hard & dry.  I've had better.
author: Tracy K.

description:
Hooked.

Clam chowder. Crab chowder in a tomato-based sauce. Traditional cioppino.

Each was beckoning on a cold summer day. Each looked surprisingly appealing for the quintessential tourist location.

Dearly departed grandfather would have wanted the cioppino. You bet.

Seafood heavy. Quite hearty. If only there was a bit more for my eight bucks.

Wanted more just the same.
author: Jason B.

description:
wow i don't know why this place got such bad reviews??

they have the cheapest clam chowder in a bread bowl at pier 39 ($6.75) and it's pretty darn tasty.

i ordered the regular clam chowder, my friend got the shrimp & crab chowder, and my other friend got the chicken soup. we all shared garlic fries. everyone was satisfied with their order. maybe the other stuff on the menu wasn't as good? but you can't go wrong with their clam chowder. after all, how bad can clam chowder be when you're at the pier??
author: Christine C.

description:
Meh, very mediocre fish and chips. That's about the best I can put it. I grabbed lunch here last week just because I was around checking on a field project nearby and wanted to grab a quick lunch. I would have explored for something nicer if I had more time.

At least the staff seems pretty nice. Up front by the entrance is a spot where a young lady was stationed who would smile and ask if I wanted a beer. I'm not a daytime drinker and I was on the job, or else I might have been tempted because of her. :)
author: H K.

description: AMAZING fish wrap. I've heard the hype and tried about three or four times to like fish tacos but just didn't "get it" until I had this fish wrap. It was fresh and  amazingly DELICIOUS, don't think about it, just DO IT. I could not stop talking about it. My daughter was laughing at me - it was that good! It was $9 and worth EVERY penny. We got the garlic fries and they are SERIOUSLY garlic. Fortunately, we are garlic lovers but I'm telling you, it's strong (loved those, too!) Fries are definitely a big enough portion to share. So good I wanted to detour by there again on the way to the airport just for another wrap!
author: Laura K.

description:
Love the fried clam strips.

One of the rare places that sells this.

Not too high of a price at $8 for this and fries.

Drench with a lemon, then dip in the tartar sauce, and enjoy!
author: Realtor Karl B.

description:
The only really good thing about this is the fact that it is located on the pier.  

In terms of menu, they have decent variety.  I got the sea food bowl with friend shrimp, calimari and scallops.  It was pretty good, filling but nothing gourmet.  They have some out door and indoor seating which is cool.  

Prices are kinda high for the food but that is expected in a touristy area such as the pier.  Fun times if you are just in the mood for an informal snack.
author: Rimi K.

description:
Came here with friends today despite the scorching heat. Inside was like a toaster since outside was so hot!

When we first walked in there was a little line which was okay even though that meant waiting in somewhat uncomfortable temperature. I ordered fish and chips because it is Pier 39 and I have to have fish/chips whenever I come here. I wasn't that excited to see the price of $8.75 (but practically $10 with taxes) but I decided to give it a shot. My order was called out and when I saw the little tray, it's exactly what it was, a LITTLE tray. The tray was filled with two very small laughable fish pieces and a handful of fries and practically a sample cup of slaw. I mean don't get me wrong, they were fresh and crispy and delicious, but for the price I paid, I guess I was expecting a little more to convince me to come back...I ate my food and was a little sad since the slaw that came with it was a vinaigrette slaw and not the traditional cool mayonnaise slaw (and not to mention that the portion of food that is given is not enough to satisfy a guy of my size).

I would definitely give some other places a try on the pier that sell fish & chips next time. Hopefully the others have a better bang for the buck.
author: Alex T.

description: Hungry for fish & chips and ate here after I found Cod Mothers closed. It was ok... nothing standing out really good or bad. Fish was pre-breaded frozen variety. Fries and slaw was good. Service was blah. It was run by a crew of young people that seemed to care less about you or your food. There are too many eating establishments on Pier 39 to settle for this.
author: Boyd P.

description: This is my second time here and I love this place. I read some of the reviews and I have to disagree. I had their combo basket the first time and their shrimp wrap the second and loved them both. What attracted me to this restaurant was the actual clientele eating inside. Very relaxed feel to the restaurant and an inviting atmosphere. Great for a quick lunch or hang around and share a pitcher of cold beer. Friendly staff and clean kitchen. I honestly cannot complain about this restaurant. Keep up the good work!
author: Marcial B.

description:
This is a fish'n'chips joint so I figured the fish'n'chips are a must get. I got them and I was not too impressed. It was made with cod and pretty standard, other than being surprisingly not oily. Despite being less oily, it was worse than my usual joint back in Westminster. The fries were oily and not too good. I didn't think it was excessively expensive ($8), the portion wasn't too large but just enough to fill me up. It wasn't too bad. 

Honestly, there was just nothing special enough about this place to warrant a better rating. But if you want fish and chips and something relatively cheap (compared to the other restaurants on Pier 39) then come here~


The GF ordered the Cajun Popcorn Shrimp and she adds:
"It was really good! Just enough kick to be interesting to the tongue with a good portion size, price wise it wasn't too good though, so I think it probably deserves a 3.5 stars"
author: Christopher D.

description: If I had a choice I wouldnt even give this place one star. This place has NO CONSISTENCY!! I ordered a wrap the first time and it wasnt bad. I was excited to come back but the wrap had no taste and it was just falling apart. No wonder this place has such a low review. Dont waste your time and come here....SPEND YOUR MONEY SOMETHING THAT IS ACTUALLY WORTH IT!! DO NOT COME HERE :)..
author: Monika B.

description:
Spicy Shrimp and Crab Chowder. AMAZING. I think it's tomato based because it's red, but I'm not sure. It tastes delicious and got a bit of a kick. Not very spicy, but enough to make it interesting. Yum! You can get it in a small cup, large cup, or bread bowl (~$6)

Usually lines aren't too bad. There's not really an order to the line, you just go to anyone who looks free and then you pay at the two cash registers. 

GO GET THAT CHOWDA!
author: Nancy L.

description:
The service is quick and straight to the point, but at the same time, obnoxiously unfriendly.  The cashier was blasting into my ear my order...c'mon lady, i'm not friggin deaf! :(  Also, the staff looked quite intimidating with a great lack of smiles and amiable personalities.

I ordered a crab cake sandwich which DID NOT look freshly made.  It looked like they bought it from costco and barely had any flavor in it.  It was oily and quite smushy, even deep frying it didn't help. 

And finally, i paid friggin $3.00 for a cup of lemonade...and there is NO complimentary or minimal charge refill!!!! come on, i'll even pay a few cents for a refill, but to buy a whole another cup?  SCREW THAT!!!
author: David T.

description: Wtf? $11 got me a couple shrimp, awful calamari, and Costco fish. How can you not have fees fish on pier 39? Never again.
author: Andrew H.

description:
Why does this place have so many bad reviews?

I came here during the new years weekend, I was SUPER HUNGRY and we walked into this place. We split the 1/4 combo. 1/4 rack of ribs and 1/4 chicken. Comes with a dinner roll and it was about $12 total. Pretty pricey but we were hungry and getting tired of the same old clam chowder bowl (Even though the ones here were cheaper than usual!)

The food was ok, it wasnt that bad. I thought it was good, but I was really hungry, So I guess everything at that time tasted good. 

Its pretty overpriced here but what eatery in Pier 39 is not? You cant even get a can of soda for less than $2 here.
author: Daniel S.

description: Salmon plate was very nice; fish & chips ok as well. Give it 3 stars because every table in the place was dirty & the prices are quite high.
author: Scott G.

description:
I always eat here. I don't know why, because it's not that great. 
But I guess here are a few reasons:
No lines. Food is made fast. Clam chowder!
Don't have to deal with a sit-down restaurant.

On another note:
The garlic fries are disgusting. Sogggggy.
Pretty pricey for the lack of quality in the food.
There's pigeons that are flying IN the restaurant,
which freaks me out sometimes..
..but I admit I feed those pigeons.
author: Azalea F.

description:
The clam chower was pretty good. 

Seafood combo was $$$ and had very actual seafood pieces in it. Def not worth the $10. 

Sit outside as the inside smells like a fryer and is pretty stuffy. Can't really expect too much in such a touristy spot.
author: Ailee F.

description:
Almost gave us food poisoning... I took my 2-year-old to Pier 39 one day after an appointment. She wanted to eat french fries and I wanted some fish and chips. I thought I'd try this place out. There was not one customer in the restaurant (which should have been my first hint). The food didn't look to appetizing in the photos, but we were hungry and my daughter saw the hot dog and said she wanted it. I ordered a child's hot dog with fries and the fried seafood combo. We sat down at the tables outside. 

The food arrived--an overcooked and rubbery hot dog with a refrigerator-cold bun. The fries were fries--and my daughter isn't picky. We squirted the ketchup from the massive containers sitting out in the sun on the picnic table. It looked runny and smelled odd. So I dipped my finger in for a quick taste--yuck! Luckily it was only a drop and my daughter had not yet put it all over her food. 

I told the guy at the counter, who without any words, took the hot dog plate with ketchup on it and walked away. He didn't even take the container off the table! I was fed up, so I handed him back all of the food and said I wanted my money back. I was so frustrated and hungry. He gave me some money and I quickly left forgetting to count it. I ended up down at the Wipeout instead and realized he had only given me the money for my seafood combo and not the $6 child hot dog meal. I went back and he acted rudely and couldn't seem to understand why I didn't want to eat  at his restaurant. Then he said he only gave me back $8 because he thought we wanted to eat the hot dog (even though we didn't keep any of the food! dumb.).

 What a disaster! Hopefully this place will close down before it poisons anyone--a completely horrible experience! Pier 39 is a top tourist attraction and should not allow such a sub par restaurant to operate on its premises.
author: Nicole H.

description: While we were sitting inside of the restaurant waiting for our food, pigeons were flying in and walking on the tables! INSIDE!! And the workers did nothing about it..the restaurant was filthy..bird poop and feathers all over the floor and tables..none of the tables were clean. Several birds almost flew into me trying to get my food! And the food by the way was nasty..over 30 bucks for 2 fish and chips that we ate a few bites of and threw away..we will never go back. Disgusting!
author: Ashley L.

description:
Absolutely gross. Got a scallop basket and I can't even guarantee they were actually scallops. No flavor at all, the batter was overcooked and tasteless, and the fries were so crispy they were more like potato chips.
The pigeons wandering through the place seemed to enjoy them though.
author: Sheri K.

description:
I came here to buy my lunch during my break. I only came here because it was close to where I worked and there never seem to be a line. The food looks yummy but the pricing did not. The price was a tad bit expensive for a small plate of food. I ordered the fish and chip and only recieved a handful of fries with two fish sticks. I had discount but it was still expensive. I will have to find another cheaper place with better food.

* Okay the only food that seem somewhat cheap with the discount I got is the clam chowder bread bowl and soda.
author: Jen M.

description:
The only reason why you'd come here is because you don't want to wait in line, you are super hungry, and there's tables available.

Don't expect great tasting food or good food quality. It's just a snack thats mildly priced and filling, NOT TASTY

anyways wouldn't really want to go back here unless I was superrr hungry
author: Aaron C.

description:
Food cooks real fast!  That was the only plus at this eatery.  

No customer service at all.  None what-so-ever.  The food was drab and lacked any flavor at all.  Fish was watered down so bad, that when I bit into it, water squirted out and hit my friend's faces.  There were tons of pigeons flying around in the store as well.  Eat somewhere else on the Pier.
author: Chai S.

description: There are plenty of other places on Pier 39, don't bother stopping here. I got seafood baskets for the family, not expecting much, and I was still disappointed. The fish and chips was absolutely horrible. The entire staff looked pissed that they were there. The ones taking orders were impatient with customers.
author: Mike G.

description:
Ordered chicken strips and the Cajun popcorn shrimp . Order came fairly fast . Employees let us stay in after their closing time . What great service . I was surprised at all the bad comments because the reviews for this place was great ! Although some workers were rude and walked away but some were amazing they all looked like they were having a good time . All in all this place is a great place for something to munch on when you have the munchies . 

Great place !
author: John C.

description:
the reason we chose this place is because they served SPICY SHRIMP AND CRAB CHOWDER IN A SOURDOUGH BREAD BOWL.  me and the girlfriend usually get clam chowder/gumbo in a bread bowl while at disneyland...and every other eatery at pier 39 sold the same thing...so we wanted to try something different.  

...but just like disneyland, or any other theme park...this place leaves their food under heating lamps or under some sort of heating system.  don't expect fresh food here.  you pay, they scoop you some of their pre-prepared soup and then you eat.

the food itself wasn't that bad.  but one thing that bothered me, that i won't blame the restaurant for...were the pigeons.  pigeons seemed to be in every store on the pier.  i thought it was cute at first....until i noticed there was bird poop ON THE TABLE.  it wasn't on the food, but still...kinda gross.  i hope they regularly clean and disinfect the tables, cuz that's just nastaaaay.
author: Pacifico O.

description:
I think there's something wrong with me...
Everytime I visit Fisherman's Wharf I get this craving for fish and chips.   So I'm walking around the pier looking for a place to grab a quick bite when I see "Hook & Cook."  To be completely honest, the place looked pretty cool.  A few picnic tables on the outside and some tables on the inside and this place was busy.  So I assumed the food would be good or at least reasonably priced.  Boy was I in for a disappointment.  For $7 bucks, I got two pieces of fish and the stale french fries.  My meal tasted like it had been sitting around for a few hours.  I ate the fish, but I ended up giving most of my fries to the sea gulls.  I think they're using them for nesting material.
author: Duong N.

description:
This place was recently remodeled and I must say that it looks way better now!

They also changed the menu and added burger and sausages to it. The Louisiana hot link with grilled peppers and onions is a thumbs up. Not many places at the pier offer a good, cheap place to eat. The sausage with chips was only $6! Great deal!

They also have this new grilled chicken burger which contains coleslaw inside. The coleslaw is amazing and unique and gives the burger a kick to it.

The workers are fast-paced, and very hospitable. It's undertandavle
For them to be a little on the edge since they have to constantly deal
With hungry, rude customers all day who talk down to them just because they are in a fast food restaurant. I give the workers props for being very polite as well as make my
Food very fast. 

There are still pigeons roaming around, but compared to how it was before, the pigeons are a bit scarce. I mean the pigeons have a 5-second memory span and they can't help but fly into a restaurant with a very open and welcoming door.
author: Phi T.

description: This place blows! Dirty, nasty place. Tables weren't clean. Food was overcooked and overpriced. $30 for fish and chips and the 8.5 oz sodas that we got ripped off on. Once I realized they had fountain soda, I tried exchanging them which turned into fiasco. And the soda was flat and they wouldn't change the CO2. When we asked to just get the bottled sodas instead, they said there was a price difference. 16 cents!! We had to douse the fish in vinegar and tartar sauce to eat it. Nasty. Don't do it!
author: Chris W.

description:
*****The 3 star is ONLY for the spicy shrimp & crab chowder they serve here!!*****

i come here only for their spicy shrimp & crab chowder that isnt sold anywhere else. Ordered the fish & chip as well today and clearly it wasn't a meal worth $17! Okay, maybe the fish & chip wasn't worth close to $9. All you'll get is 2 frozen fish that clearly looked like it has been sitting there. The shrimp & crab chowder was delicious though!!! 

There's always pigeons roaming the floor in here.. They were even chilling on the tables! I clearly do not understand why there isn't a door to this place that keeps those filthy things out! It flys all over the place when customers are eating... I am truly disgusted by the slightest sight of pigeons. 

In conclusions, I will be back for those shrimp & crab chowder. Only this time I will order to go and eat it somewhere else. AWAY from those filthy pigeons.
author: Jenny G.

description: Aww I had higher expectations for this place. First of all, the tables were so nasty and filled with pigeon crap. There were obese pigeons, pigeons with missing legs, all types of nasty pigeons sitting near you waiting for you to walk away from your food. They're all inside the dining area too. Even if I take food here to go, it's not worth it. Two pieces of fish and fries cost $7. They taste not as great as the one at Jack-in-the-Box for how much? $3.99? Yeah. Less quantity too. The clam chowder was okay. Too much of sourdough bread, too little of clam chowder.
author: Christine N.

description: This has always been my go-to place when I'm starving after a day around the city and I just want a fast, but decent meal. First of all, both their spicy and regular chowder is bomb. I usually get garlic fries and the crab cake sandwhich, which is a must if you haven't tried it yet. They also are linked to a mini donut place right in front of it called Trish's Donuts, which I always grab a couple for dessert after. They lose a star for their customer service. I have often found that the staff isn't too friendly, which is a downer for such a touristy area.
author: Tiffany L.

description: Fish and chips were way over priced and tasted awful. Extremely fishy smell and taste to them Chowder was over priced and not very good and we got the garlic fries which were soggy and just had a little bit of some minced garlic. Not to mention one of the older ladies who seemed to be in charge had the worst attitude like she could care less about everything.  Pigeons were flying inside and almost landed in my food. Won't ever go there again. walk two doors down and save some money and actually eat real food not over priced fried stuff with no fish.
author: Brianna W.

description: This place has the worst service I have ever seen! The cooks took 15 minutes to cook my meal but the rest of my party's was done in 5 minutes and after all that the manager refused to give me a discount on a drink refill. STAY AWAY!!!!
author: Christian T.

description: It wasn't as bad as I expected it to be. The fried oysters were good and so was the clam chowder bowl. The service was quick and the food was extra hot which was perfect for the cold weather.
author: Ben E.

description:
Highly priced food...not tasty...bad customer service...need I say more?

the only positive was you get your food quick.

If you have a few more minutes to spare, try the Bubba Gump next door.
author: Rajeev N.

description: The clean interior caught my attention and there was a table in the back that fit our whole party....that's the only reason we ate there. Other than that, the experience was...meh. I ordered the seafood crab cake, which is basically a small patty inside hamburger buns. The garlic fries is disgusting and the chowder was average.
author: Talle R.

description: Food was ready quick, but once they took your money they don't care about customer service. I think there all about get in eat get out as quick as possible. Oh yeah and if you want a refill on your small soda its gonna cost $.82 that's damn near buying another soda, and all I got was attitude from the employees like I wasting there time. I don't recommend unless you are in a hurry and trying to get out quick.
author: Carlos S.

description: I made the mistake of choosing to eat here. It's fast and they have the standard bread bowl clam chowder and an array of fried seafood and chips. But nothing stood out as a must go back. It was ok for what it was. Better clam chowder elsewhere.
author: Grace C.

description: This place is interesting - it was one of the reasonable price restaurants in Pier 39.  The only thing that was kind of weird was that fact that they served fish and chips on one side and chicken and ribs on the other side.  Same restaurant some owners just kinda random.  The food was good and fresh.
author: May A.

description: I'm a bit surprised to see this place got such low reviews. San Francisco sure is spoiled, the clam chowder bowls here are still better than any you'll find in the san joaquin valley. Not everyone wants to pay 12 bucks for a clam chowder bowl at a fancy restaurant. For poor college students just taking a day trip, this place is just right. My only complaint is that the bottom of the bowl was more bread than chowder. Other than that, it was great. Obviously nobody would come specifically here for the food, but if you just want the food without the fuss, Hook & Cook will do just fine.
author: Byron C.

description: I ordered the seafood combo. It was pricey & boring.  I guess it's pretty standard at Pier 39.  The most concern I have is the pigeons.  They are not shy coming into the eating area inside.  I didn't see any staff trying to clean up the tables during my visit.  I'll not come back because of the pigeons.
author: C S.

description: The restaurant's only occupants were the pigeons when I walked in, which was totally understandable; February isn't exactly tourist season here in San Francisco. What wasn't understandable however was the fact that it took freakin forever just to fry some fish and chips, I was on the verge of telling them to just refund my order when bam it was finally done. As for the food, the name "hook & cook", would imply that everything is caught from the sea and cooked here; nope! it all came from a package which pisses me off even more that it took forever for my order to arrive... to take something out the package and throw it in the fryer shouldn't take damn near 30 minutes when the restaurant is completely empty(It seemed like there was something wrong with each batch they kept frying up when I watched them making it, they would throw it in the trashcan and fry up a new batch). Oh and the service...lol don't even get me started on that.
author: Mike A.
